Patch Set 6:

User not approved, see admin, no CI

Please split this into multiple commits.

There shouldn't be a system just named "minerva".  Is this the compute card or the CMM?  There should be code-names for each of these sub-assemblies.  If you don't have the code-name please reach out to the system TPM.
We need to add this to phosphor-dbus-interfaces also.
Yes, I will add MinervaHarma in phosphor-dbus-interfaces

BMC type added, please have a check with link below
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/+/67726
I'm going to remove this support in fb-ipmi-oem.  Go ahead and drop this.
I want to be clear that this content should not be in here permanently.  We need to find another way than random shell scripts to do this activity.

I don't see anything below this line being used.  Please don't copy/paste shell-scripts indeterminately from other platforms.

I'd prefer if we don't have a lot of shell scripts.  Ideally there should be zero shell scripts left when the program is done.  If we have some common utilities we think are going to be applicable (since you've copy/pasted them from elsewhere) then let's refactor this into some common shell script utility package rather than copy/pasting code across platforms.
This looks like it was copy/pasted from Bletchley?
Something seems wrong here if we're referring to sleds?
What is the purpose of this file?  Entity-manager should handle this, right?  I don't know why we need this IPMI YAML file.
This looks like a bunch of copy/paste from bletchley.  Please don't do that.
Due to Vboot not ready, this is for backup Dual image function, It will disable WDT2 to avoid watchdog timeout.
We need documentation on what is going on here.  I don't know why we're setting random GPIOs in the initramfs.
Why do we have this file?
We may not use x86-power-control on any future meta-facebook systems.  Please leverage phosphor-state-manager.
We don't have BIC. Should we keep it?
Can we use X86 for power on, we need study show to use phosphor-state-manager.

Patrick,
  We have submitted an application to the OpenBMC, but CLA is not yet completed, so the CI build hasn't started. I'm unsure who can help with this. Can you assist in checking it?
